content: For the community survey, we'd like to ask about Rust versions people use. Instead of a free form response where people just put whatever version they use, we have some preset ones. One thing we were wondering was what version of Rust do linux distros currently provide? How old are they usually compared to the latest stable?

Ubuntu 21.10: 1.51
Ubuntu 20.04: 1.51
Debian stable: 1.48
Debian testing: 1.50
Fedora 34: 1.56
Fedora 35: 1.56
CentOS 7/EPEL: 1.55
CentOS 8: 1.52.1 (!)
Arch Linux: 1.56
Alpine 3.13.1: 1.47
That's for amd64, for other architectures you'll find older versions. From what I've seen, Debian users are the most likely to want to use their distro version.
And Arch Linux, at least, packages rustup too, so you can use that to get whatever toolchain you want.
a few other distros have rustup too https://pkgs.org/search/?q=rustup

was what version of Rust do linux distros currently provide

Are you also asking if people opt into using what the distro provides?

I maintain a crate that supports back to 1.34 because it's not overly difficult for me to do so, but I'm always happy to use some of those newer features where possible.
Debian testing will have 1.56 fairly shortly (a week or so).

would be nice to have some kind of up-to-date list somewhere (maybe the rust forge?)
It could be useful for making decisions like "what what minimum rust version should my crate have" as in "do I want it to build on debian stable or not?" etc :)

well, not a single place but these two links seem to cover it
